description: The year is 1991 and 6th grader Yaguchi Haruo only has video games to live for. He's not popular in school and he's neither handsome, funny, nice nor even friendly. The only thing he has going for him is that he is good at video games. One day at the local arcade, he plays Oono Akira, a fellow classmate but who's popular, smart, pretty and a rich girl that absolutely destroys him at Street Fighter II. Not only does he lose to her 30 times in a row, he can’t beat her at any game. Haruo can’t seem to shake Akira off as she follows him from arcade to arcade everyday after school and beats him every time. As weird as it sounds, the odd couple begins a strange bond and friendship.

tags.name: Video Games
tags.description: Centers around characters playing video games.

tags.name: Full CGI
tags.description: Almost entirely created with computer-generated imagery.

tags.name: Love Triangle
tags.description: Centered around romantic feelings between more than two people. Includes all love polygons.

tags.name: Urban
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a city.

tags.name: Ojou-sama
tags.description: Features a wealthy, high-class, oftentimes stuck up and demanding female character.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Time Skip
tags.description: Features a gap in time used to advance the story.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Tsundere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who acts cold and hostile in order to mask warmer emotions.

tags.name: Slapstick
tags.description: Prominently features comedy based on deliberately clumsy actions or embarrassing events.

tags.name: Primarily Child Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters below a high school age.

tags.name: CGI
tags.description: Prominently features scenes created with computer-generated imagery.

title.native: ハイスコアガールEXTRA STAGE

node.description: Originating from [Madhouse](https://anilist.co/studio/11/). He is a member of the Writers Guild of Japan.

Longtime video game composer for Square Co., Ltd. and arguably one of the most prolific female game composers in the world, Yoko Shimomura is behind the music for games such as Legend of Mana and Parasite Eve. She is likely best known for her work on the Kingdom Hearts series and the Mario & Luigi series.

__[Official Website](http://yakushimaruetsuko.com/)__ | __[Profile](http://yakushimaruetsuko.com/category/profile)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/mirairecords)__ | __[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/mirairecords/)__

__Etsuko Yakushimaru__, alternatively known as Tika Alpha when writing lyrics and doing composition, is a Japanese singer, producer, composer, lyricist, arranger, artist, who is also a member and lead vocalist for the band [Soutaisei Riron](https://anilist.co/staff/152353/) (相対性理論).

__[Website](https://soratobsakana.tokyo/)__ | __[Blog (JP)](http://ameblo.jp/soratobsakana/)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/soratobsakana)__

__Formed:__ July 21, 2014
**Disbanded:** September 6, 2020

__Sora Tob Sakana__ was an idol group specializing in math rock tunes composed by [Yoshimasa Terui](https://anilist.co/staff/161984/Yoshimasa-Terui). The group was the second idol unit created by artist management company Flying Penguin Records and talent agency Theatre Academy.

__Members:__
- Natsuka Teraguchi (寺口夏花)
- Fuka Kanzaki (神﨑風花)
- Mana Yamazaki (山崎愛)

__Former Members:__
- Rei Maraika Kazama (風間玲マライカ)
- Yuiko Konishi (小西結子)
- Mio Satou (佐藤美緒)

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/明田川仁)

Affiliated with Magic Capsule, a recording studio led by his father [Susumu Aketagawa](https://anilist.co/staff/120062).

**Bruno Méyère** is a French voice actor and director for anime.

**Non-anime roles:**
~!- A.J. in "Gutterballs" (French)
- Campbell in "Burn Notice" (French)
- Geek in "Astropia" (French)
- K.C. Guthrie in "Degrassi Next Generation" (French)
- Michelangelo in "Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles 2012" (French)!~

Twitter **Irwin Daayán Rosenthal Sarlí** is a Mexican voice actor. He is known for being the Latin American Spanish voice of Yugi Muto and Pharaoh Atem in _Yu-Gi-Oh!_, Anakin Skywalker in _Star Wars_ and Samsagaz "Sam" Gamyi in _The Lord of the Rings_. He is the recurring dub voice of Sebastian Stan and Hayden Christensen. Non-Anime Roles: - Ajay Ghale (Far Cry 4) - Kung Jin (Mortal Kombat X) - Kindred (League of Legends)
Originating from [Madhouse](https://anilist.co/studio/11/). He is a member of the Writers Guild of Japan.

**[Twitter](https://twitter.com/mill_sister)** | **[Website (blog)](https://blog.goo.ne.jp/gooussy)**

Kiyoko Sayama is a Japanese director, episode director, animation director and storyboard artist.

Married to [Tetsuya Kumagai](https://anilist.co/staff/101548/Tetsuya-Kumagai).

__[Twitter](https://twitter.com/YoshimasaTerui)__

__Yoshimasa Terui__ is a Japanese composer, arranger and guitarist. He composed music for the idol unit [Sora Tob Sakana](https://anilist.co/staff/126806/Sora-Tob-Sakana) and is a member of the math-rock band Haisuinonasa.
